description: keren, bagus, lebih baik dari pada aplikasi bawaan

This used to be one of my favorites because if it's simplicity along with useful feature set. Now I can't get it to run at all. I've installed from apt-get, and from ubuntu software. It crashes immediately upon loading.

Time and again, no matter what distro I'm on, gThumb becomes my image editor. Easy and effective image viewing, but the clincher is the basic, built-in editing features that I need: rotate (lossless), resize, rename, colour adjustment.

I installed gThumb on my Ubuntu 18.10 system, which dual-boots with Windows 10. I had a directory with 349 images on an external (USB3.0) hard drive formatted as NTFS. When I selected one of the files and renamed it, nothing went wrong. I then selected the remainder of the files and attempted to rename it with the pattern "cons-####" and starting at 400. I clicked on "rename" and all 348 files were gone. No trace. I don't have other copies of these because the service I had them backed up on has shut down. I'm fairly devastated, as these are pictures I took over many years at SF conventions. I thought I had other copies, but my attempt to find them has failed.

BE CAREFUL!
summary: DANGEROUS: On Ubuntu 18.10, rename multiple files erases them entirely

description: Much better than Shotwell

Clean and simple. Most used feature is probably "crop".

Use good old plain filesystem and doesn't try to "organize" pictures for you, as shotwell does.
The best image organizer, image basic editor and duplicate file finder available for GNOME, I personally love it and i am sure that for most of GNOME users out there they will love it too
This is "a must have app".
Is'nt it working with ubuntu 18.04
Simple and clean GUI and let me view and organize the RAW files from my Nikon effortlessly.
Can you say dev necrobumping his own work? nice try but fair's fair right?

i like it and from the day i discover it is the only one that i use to see my photos .
i have only 1 issue but is personal: i really don' t like the white border that automatically appear on the photos. i would prefer something like a shading effect.
It crashes all the time
Everything is good but where is the light theme we need consistency in themeing

This is hands down the best native Linux image browser, for my needs - compared with Gnome Image Browser, nomacs(-lounge), Geeqie, and Shotwell. It doesn't mess with the classic thumbnail layout with filename/size/date at a glance below the thumb, has decent batch-renaming capability (with templates), file conversion, cropping, and basic image tweaking. It comes with loads of web service plugins that I don't need, and which can be deactivated, thankfully. AND the most common Windows hotkeys work (F2, Ctrl-S, Ctrl-F...)

Where it currently s*cks is speed - loading folder contents takes slightly less time than forever (subjectively; on Ubuntu 19.x). Deactivating Search/Catalog plugins doesn't fix the issue (I'm a newbie, no idea if this makes sense, forgive my ignorance). Every other app is (a lot) faster. What's going on here? 
How about including a simple list view for speed/pain relief, without thumbnails?

Batch renaming files on NTFS drives works flawlessly for me (once they're loaded...), whatever deleted the previous commenter's files must have been a bug.

Power users and Windows refugees, check out XnView MP, it's available as an AppImage and still better than any Linux app I've encountered so far. Here are some features worth stealing from it:
- batch rename search & replace
- batch rename templates - new file name based on selected file (double click)
- thumbnail background colors based on file type...
For the first sight - very, very good.
Applications itself is nice but I can't give more that three stars because there's no option to disable dark theme to correspond gnome classic white system theme. It's pity.
summary: no option to disable dark theme

description: light and perfect!

Guys, you have created a great useful app, but since I switched to fuji, I start suffer, because the app can't show the photos properly now. This is happening because fujifilm has not standard meta resolution field for vertical photos, where height and weight are swapped.
(4000x6000 not 6000x4000)
So, photos are flattened.
Please, help resolve this issue.

Gee downloaded from Ubuntu Activities on two identical machines. Got the same version but Preferences are under the top bar on one and in the drop down menu on the other? Pint - what I really need it for is under "Right click" on the image (No menu?) My printer trays don't show up but picking the size of the paper installed finds the correct tray. Works but?????

1. Memory leak: after editing several photos, the RAM usage jumps to gigabytes and won't free up until restarted.
2. Saving as... won't work after editing a photo and it prompts like can't save with no reason to show.
summary: Basically a good gallery app but a lot of issues

description: Never had any issues or problems. It has always worked well for me.

I was looking for a replacement for Faststone in Windows. This isn't it, but it does a very good job of presenting the sort of browsing and editing options that most of us need for day to day work. 

The interface could be a little more intuitive. For example, to cycle through files one by one in full screen you have to use the space key or backspace when the arrow keys would be much more obvious. I know the pcx format is now ancient, but it would be a nice addition if GThumb could handle them.

Still, this is my go to program in Linux when I want to browse or do minor changes to photos or bitmap graphics.

gThumb 3.9.1 soon will be coming. See OMG! UBUNTU!
Website to have a look. ?
Beautiful, quick, simple.
every day in use
Ubuntu 18.04. Working fine.
It can't crop a picture on Ubuntu 20.04
Supports WebP and makes clipping easy, big wins for me.
summary: Much better than the Nautilus image viewer

description:
Using this because I need to display webp images. 

Starts instantly. Covers most functions you'd need in a clear interface. Doesn't create automatic libraries that show your nudes every time you open the app (looking at you Shotwell). The ability to manually create catalogues is neat.
i use Ubuntu 18.04.5 and this app works flawlessly on it. I'm amazed at how it instantly resizes my photos, producing scaled, lossless images. Thank you gThumb Image Viewer.
This has been my go-to image handler for years. Very convenient for viewing, sorting and renaming pics, and does all the basic editing i need 90% of the time.
Simple and easy. Thank you!
Simple but yet very featured. Works for organizing my astrophotography collection.

By far the best and simple to use for beginners and advance users!
it makes sizeable a picture so simple for beginners and you can do so many other things with it like background colours adjustable, balance, gamma,contrasts and many more effects
it works flawless on Fedora 33 and Elementary 5.1
I do recommend 100%

gThumb feels like a still WIP gnome project, but it has a ton of great features that makes me love it. When it comes to having an efficient workflow, between quickly cropping an image and running a bash compression script on thirty files at once, gThumb meets all of my needs.
summary: Buggy, but feature-rich; Custom bash script support is a big win

description: Nice to crop pictures and perform simple editing

Works very well and opens fast big images even on my old computer, I love the interface and some additional editing features are handy for quick editing. The best Linux image browser I've been using so far.

The app does a lot of things and does them well. It's also has a nice UI which you can use to click around instead of using a keyboard. It's also the only app I've encountered that lets you browse the images by date created, name, etc.

However, I haven't been able to customize the shortcuts, which is a shame. But nevertheless it gets a 5 star from me.

description: Gthumb has a very user-friendly interface, but it would probably be in your best interest to nix all the extensions you don’t really need, especially the file management extension, which can cause you to accidentally move files into the Great Unknown. Also, I suspect some of the extensions were bogging down the resources on my ’puter.

Plus, it's easy to use!

The cataloging feature doesn't work well. It created dozens of catalogs which I had to manually delete one by one. I would rather it create one catalog. Also, it displays the catalogs rather slowly when the images are in the cloud. Lastly, there's no light UI.

Schön, schlank und trotzdem vielseitig.

Ist für Linuxnutzer super, benutze um die mehrere PDF zu einem buch zusammen zuführen.

Nachdem in meinem geliebten Gwenview die KIPI- Plugins, hier besonders die durchdachte Stapelverarbeitung, verschwunden sind und somit der Nutzen für mich gegen null geht ist gThumb eine gute Alternative. Ich muss mich zwar etwas umgewöhnen da er aus der Gnome-Welt kommt, aber er macht was er soll und ist dabei recht flott.

description: Jedoch stürzt beim Programmstart neuerdings immer der Rechner ab. Deinstall nicht möglich, es wird verweigert.

Was ich an Software für andere Systeme nicht mag ist, dass wenn man Zusatzinfos einträgt wie Kommentare etc. diese häufig in einem proprietären Format gespeichert werden. Nicht so hier, so weit es geht landet alles in EXIF und Co. und in einer (versteckten) XML Datei. So kann ich, sollte ich mal irgendwann das Programm wechseln wollen, auch alle Daten mitnehmen. Auch werden Verzeichnisse als Alben akzeptiert. Sehr praktisch, da ich schon vor 20 Jahren meine Fotos so sortiert habe und so werden sie auch in Zukunft sortiert bleiben.
Nicht ganz volle Punkte weil mehr Features möglich wären, z.B. eine Karte, auf der alle Fotos im Verzeichnis eingetragen werden.

Rien à dire comme sur windows, même en mieux !

Cette application fait aussi bien visionneuse (photo et vidéo) que retouche rapide photo. Elle est très facile à prendre en main et bien pensée. En revanche, elle n'est adaptée que pour de la retouche simple. L'avantage c'est qu'on ne se perd pas dans tous les menus compliqués de Gimp qui est néanmoins plus complet.
Quel dommage de ne pas pouvoir voir la date de prise de vue des photos lors de l'importation. Sans cela ce programme ne sert tout simplement à rien ! :(

très efficace pout traitement TRES rapide images: luminosité contraste netteté recadrage convertissage de format... A ne pas comparer avec Lightroom ou Rawtherapee ça n'est pas du tout la même utilisation!.
PLus facile et simple que Digikam et autres. Efficace. Parfait ! Gestion des doublons, rapide, dingue !
summary: Genial, rapide, simple, mieux que Digikam, gestion des doublons !

description: Почему то столкнулся с проблемой: фотку со смартфона не может изменить, лагает и подвисает, а пол фото просто под чёрным экраном.

+ Поддержка плагинов/расширений
+ Поддержка Webp!!
+ Много полезных настроек
  + Настройки сохранения изображений
  + Настройка внешнего вида

Спасибо!

На своём компьютере я установил gThumb в качестве основного приложения для открытия изображений, т.к. оно полностью покрывает все мои потребности. От такого приложения мне необходимы две возможности:
1) Вырезать у открывшейся фотографии область и сохранить как отдельное изображение. Это могут многие (но не все) программы. В gThumb это называется "кадрирование".
2) Сохранить с фотоаппарата на компьютер фотографии большого размера и сразу все их сжать до меньшего размера. Эту возможность из программ с графическим интерфейсом я не нашёл нигде кроме gThumb. Тут, правда, нет отдельной кнопки для такой операции, но зато при нажатии "Изменить размер" для группы фотографий происходит сжатие.

Отличный функциональный обозреватель изображений, имеет множество функций, но при этом совершенно не умеет в мультипоток. Если зайти в папку с большим кол-вом изображений, очень долго переваривает миниатюры на 1 ядре, но потом всё шустро.
На Ubuntu 18.04 не устанавливается - сломанные зависимости
summary: На Ubuntu 18.04 не устанавливается - сломанные зависимости

description: Всё отлично устанавливается и работает. Отличная софтина.
Хорошее приложение, легкая и имеет все необходимые инструменты

Удобный и красивый интерфейс, можно открыть изображение и каталог изображений, можно обрезать изображения, меняь размер, формат. Лучшее на мой вгляд приложение. По функционалу может быть есть и лучше, но здесь все сделано добротно и таким приятно пользоваться!

Отличная софтина для просмотра картинок. Я ещё с помощью неё меняю обои для рабочего стола. Использовал эту программу на разных Линукс-дистрибутивах, всегда без проблем устанавливалась и работала. Моя оценка 5 звезд!
Очень напрягает ядра ... Искал замену FastStone но под линукс столь универсального приложения нет, думал это поможет но глючновато, обидно.
Падает если открыть два окна
Похоже это то, что мне нужно. Был нужен способ быстрой компановки и печати нескольких изображений на одном листе. Эта программа позволяет сдеть это пару кликов.
